answers.answer: It is difficult to say for certain what is causing your symptom. Sweating is one of the major symptoms of menopause. It is good that you have been checked for diabetes. If you are in menopause now,  your thyroid needs might change since your estrogen is lower. Talk with your doctor about rechecking your thyroid levels.If your doctor is unable to find a cause, you could discuss with him/her about taking a short course of estrogen. If the symptoms go away, it would explain that they are due to menopause. If they do not, it would mean that further evaluation is needed.Machelle M. Seibel, MD

question: I have been going through menopause for over 10 years, on no meds for it and still having hot flashes and night sweats. I sweat after showering especially in the morning. I have tried over the counter remides but they do not effect me. The past 4 months whenever I do yard work, clean house, in the sun or use any energy I sweat excessively.  I mean drentching sweats where I have to shower and change clothes.  I hate this and want to know if this is normal? I do not have any excessive thirst, not diabetic, have a thyroid issue that I take med for.  Any suggestions?
title: Excessive Sweating
